meta.title: CLI Plan – v1 Next Tasks (Repo-Root Layout)
notes: This queue is for incremental v1 work after the initial Make→CLI migration.
Use this queue after the strict parity baseline in `cli_plan/tasks_v1_parity.json` is complete.
Authoritative layout: repo-root content trees, marker `project_handbook.config.json`, internals under `.project-handbook/**` (see cli_plan/v1_cli/ADR-CLI-0004-ph-root-layout.md).
Every task MUST be sized to fit a single agent session and must include deterministic tests where feasible.
Legacy reference repo for parity checks: /Users/spensermcconnell/__Active_Code/oss-saas/project-handbook (run via `pnpm make -- <target>`).

phases.title: Bootstrap + Scaffolding Completeness
goals: Ensure `ph init` produces a fully usable, validation-clean handbook repo from an empty directory.
Eliminate any remaining docs/spec drift that could cause an agent to build commands that assume pre-existing files.

phases.title: Task Templates + Pre-Exec Gate UX
goals: Make `ph task create` output compatible with `ph pre-exec lint` expectations (evidence paths, secret-scan, task id references).
Port legacy pre-exec patterns and ignore rules precisely where needed.

phases.title: Parity Audit (Domain-by-Domain)
goals: Validate `ph` behavior against the legacy Make repo for each domain (sprints, tasks, releases, backlog, parking-lot).
Document intentional deltas vs legacy behavior and ensure contracts/specs reflect them.
Ensure cross-cutting commands (help, dashboard, hooks, onboarding/end-session, reset) match the contract and legacy UX where required.

phases.title: Docs + Agent UX
goals: Ensure `cli_plan/docs` and top-level docs communicate that `ph` creates/scaffolds the entire system.
Make the “happy path” obvious for a new handbook repo: init → doctor → plan sprint → create tasks → pre-exec → execute.

tasks.title: Init scaffolds required READMEs (validation-clean)
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Update `ph init` to seed any missing directory READMEs that are considered required by the spec (e.g. `status/README.md`) and ensure all seeded markdown is validation-clean (YAML front matter included). Add/adjust tests to ensure `ph init` then `ph validate --quick` exits 0 in a fresh directory.

tasks.title: Port full session templates from legacy
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Port the real `process/sessions/templates/*.md` set from the legacy repo into the `ph init` scaffold (non-destructive; do not overwrite). Ensure templates are validation-clean (YAML front matter). Add tests that `ph onboarding session list` includes expected topics and `ph onboarding session <topic>` prints a non-empty template.

tasks.title: Fix task template evidence paths + secret-scan placeholders
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Update `ph task create` templates so the generated docs include: (1) an explicit evidence path placeholder `status/evidence/<TASK-###>/...`, and (2) an explicit `secret-scan.txt` evidence expectation. Ensure the output does NOT contain ambiguous language that triggers `ph pre-exec lint` by default (or only uses ambiguity words inside checkboxes that are ignored). Add tests to assert the generated task docs contain the evidence and secret-scan strings.

tasks.title: Research-discovery task template parity
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Ensure `ph task create --session research-discovery` scaffolds task docs that satisfy pre-exec lint alignment rules (Decision Register output expectation + exactly two options Option A / Option B). Add tests that a newly created research-discovery task triggers no session-alignment failures in `ph pre-exec lint` once required placeholders are present.

tasks.title: Pre-exec lint patterns parity audit
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Compare `ph pre-exec lint` patterns + ignore rules with the legacy `process/checks/pre_exec_audit.py` implementation. Decide which differences are intentional and which are bugs. Update implementation/tests accordingly. Acceptance: add deterministic tests covering at least one ignore-case (checkbox TODO) and one blocking-case (bare TBD).

tasks.title: Sprint parity audit vs legacy Make
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph sprint plan|open|status|tasks|close|archive|burndown|capacity` behavior against the legacy repo. For each command: confirm created files, symlink behavior, stdout hints, and post-hook behavior. Create/adjust tests to lock in at least 2 high-risk parity points (e.g. `sprints/current` behavior and close/archive outputs).

tasks.title: Release parity audit vs legacy Make
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph release *` behavior against legacy `make release-*`. Confirm `--activate` semantics, `releases/current` pointer behavior, `release show` output, and `release progress` regeneration. Add/adjust tests for at least one edge case: missing `releases/current` and missing `releases/<version>/plan.md`.

tasks.title: Backlog + parking parity audit vs legacy Make
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit backlog and parking-lot command behavior (create/list/triage/assign/stats/review/promote) against legacy Make. Confirm index.json behavior (create/rebuild/update) and non-destructive guarantees. Add tests for rebuilding missing indexes from filesystem.

tasks.title: Update cli_plan/docs to emphasize full scaffolding UX
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Review `docs/**` and `cli_plan/**` and ensure they clearly state: `ph` is responsible for scaffolding/creating the full filesystem and normal workflows do not assume pre-existing directories/files. Add/adjust a single canonical “happy path” flow: init → doctor → sprint plan → task create → pre-exec audit → execute.

tasks.title: Contract/spec drift scan automation
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Add a lightweight check (pytest or script) that scans for known-drift markers in planning/spec docs (e.g. `.ph/config.json`, `ph/**` layout references) and fails if they appear outside explicitly-marked historical docs. Keep the allowlist small and explicit.

tasks.title: Help + dashboard parity audit vs legacy Make
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph help` topic outputs and `ph dashboard` output against the legacy Make targets (`help*`, `dashboard`). Confirm banner lines, topic lists, and that Make-era command examples are rewritten to `ph` consistently. Add/adjust tests to lock in at least: (1) dashboard banner + “Recent Daily Status” behavior, (2) help contains `--scope system` line where expected by current UX.

tasks.title: Hooks + orchestration parity audit
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph hooks install`, `ph check-all`, and `ph test system` against legacy `install-hooks`, `check-all`, and `test-system`. Confirm that post-command hooks run exactly once for orchestration commands (no double history/validate). Add/adjust tests for: (1) check-all doesn’t double-run hooks, (2) test system prints expected section ordering and continues through all steps.

tasks.title: Onboarding + end-session parity audit
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph onboarding` and `ph end-session` behavior against legacy `make onboarding` and `make end-session` scripts. Confirm output paths under `process/sessions/logs/` and `process/sessions/session_end/`, manifest/index updates, and remediation messages (e.g. continue-session when missing). Add/adjust tests to cover at least: (1) end-session writes latest_summary + manifest, (2) session_end_index is updated deterministically.

tasks.title: Reset + reset-smoke safety parity audit
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph reset` and `ph reset-smoke` behavior vs legacy expectations (dry-run default, strict confirm/force, forbidden subtree protection). Ensure `ph init`-seeded `process/automation/reset_spec.json` is sufficient and safe-by-default. Add tests for at least: (1) reset refuses without exact confirm, (2) reset refuses if forbidden subtree rules are violated.

tasks.title: Roadmap parity audit + link normalization rules
tasks.kickoff_prompt: Audit `ph roadmap show|create|validate` behavior vs legacy `make roadmap*`. Confirm required headings, default seed file shape, and link normalization/validation behavior. Add tests for at least: (1) missing file remediation, (2) validate catches broken relative links under PH_ROOT.
